Description: Potter's tool; pounder, made of hard baked clay mixed with chopped straw ('tibu'), which is used in making pottery vessels.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: Miss Winifred Susan Blackman
Bibliographic references: Blackman 1927 / The Fellahin of Upper Egypt: their religious, social and industrial life to-day, with special reference to survivals from ancient times
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine (Trustees of)
Acquisition notes: Af1981,13.1 to 116 is a gift from the Wellcome Historical Medical Museum. It is recorded in the donation book as "A collection of ethnographic items from the Fallahin of Upper Egypt collected by Miss Blackman. See Eth Doc.1972." Winifred Blackman received at least six grants from the Wellcome Historical Medical Museum to make collections in Egypt between 1927-1933. She also took photographs and made copious field notes. The gift made to the British Museum comprises objects from her first season (Feb-Nov 1927) and her second season (Feb - Sept 1928)
